Class MP3Player

java.lang.Object
  MP3Player

public class MP3Player
extends Object

Class to provide a threaded MP3 Player, together with a basic end-of-play listener utilising the JLayer MP3 player from javazoom.

Use play(url) to play the file found at url.

Use stop() to stop playing before end.

Note: only one song will be played at any one time; before starting another song, the currently playing song will be stopped and any listener notified.

Optional: Having created an MP3Player, use setPlaybackListener(listener) to set the listener for handling end-of-play for this MP3Player instance.
Natural end-of-play or stop() will then generate an event on listener, to allow update of a GUI controller (e.g. enabling/disabling start/stop buttons).

Example of use: 

   MP3Player player = new MP3Player();
   player.setPlaybackListener(listener);  // optional
   player.play(songURL)
     ...
   player.stop()

where listener and songURL are the playback listener and URL string.

MP3Player is not thread-safe.

Constructor Detail

MP3Player

Creates an MP3 player

Method Detail

play

public void play(String url)
          throws IOException
Starts playing the audio file obtained at string url in a separate thread and returns. It first stops any currently playing audio.

Various exceptions will result, from I/O exceptions, non-existent/malformed urls.

At natural end-of-play, then any listeners will be notified. This can be used to toggle the enabling of any start/stop buttons on a GUI.

Parameters:
url - url to play
Throws:
IOException

stop

public void stop()
This method should be used to stop a currently playing audio track. Any listeners will be notified

setPlaybackListener

public void setPlaybackListener(PlayFinishedListener listener)
Allows listener to be set to monitor end of playback. Any existing listener for this instance of MP3Player will be overwritten.
